title: Management Continuity Decisions

content.content: This section covers decision authority, essential functions, and stakeholder management during incidents.

**Primary:** Pete (CTO/ISSO)
**Backup:** Dave (President)
**Technical Delegation:** Savvy (when Pete delegates)

items: Pete unreachable for 2+ hours during critical incident

content.content: Priority order: 1) VA nurse access 2) Authentication 3) Clinical protocols 4) Core triage functions

**Acceptable degraded operation:** Slower performance, limited features, read-only protocols
**Requires shutdown:** Authentication failures, data integrity concerns, active breach
15-minute rule: If you can't reach Pete or Dave during an active breach, initiate shutdown and contact ScaleSec.
Key metrics: **RTO:** 4 hours | **RPO:** 1 hour | **Max downtime:** 24 hours
See Contingency Plan for full BIA. At 3 hours downtime, consider alternate recovery or external help.
Communication order: 1) Team (30 min) 2) VA (1 hr) 3) ScaleSec 4) AWS Support 5) FedRAMP PMO (major only)
Dave owns VA communications. Pete handles technical response, Dave handles VA messaging.
During incidents: 1) Check PII/security risk 2) Confirm authority 3) Consider FedRAMP impact 4) Can nurses work? 5) Document decision 6) Communicate
Make the best decision with available info. Document it. Move forward. Adjust as needed.

keyTakeaways: Pete decides, Dave backs up when: Pete unavailable 2+ hrs, conflict of interest, off-hours, or delegation
Priority: VA nurse access > authentication > protocols > features
Shutdown required for: auth failures, data integrity issues, or active breach
Dave owns VA communications even when Pete manages technical response

quiz.question: During a security incident, Pete is at a medical appointment and unreachable. The system is experiencing authentication failures affecting 30% of VA nurses. As President, what is your immediate priority?
options: Wait up to 2 hours for Pete to respond before taking action
Make the decision to initiate emergency procedures and engage ScaleSec
Contact the VA to explain the situation and get their input first
Delegate the technical decisions to Savvy while you handle communications
